step.context: \textbf{Check Point }\# 1: \text{ Is the function defined} \\ \text{and continuous in } \left[ \frac{\pi}{6}, \frac{\pi }{4} \right] ?
step.tex: \text{Yes. } \mathrm{cosec} \, x = \dfrac{1}{\sin x} \text{ is defined and}\\ \text{is continuous in } \left[ \frac{\pi}{6}, \frac{\pi }{4} \right]
\text{No. } \mathrm{cosec} \, x = \dfrac{1}{\sin x} \text{ and}\\ \text{ is not }\text{continuous at } x =0 \\ \therefore \text{It is discontinuous in }\left[ \frac{\pi}{6}, \frac{\pi }{4} \right]
step.reason: \int^{b}_{a}f(x)\, dx \text{ makes sense only if f(x) is} \\ \text{defined and is continuous in [a, b].} \\ \text{For e.g.} \int^{\pi / 4}_{- \pi/4}\mathrm{cosec}\, x\, dx \text{ does not because}\\ \mathrm{cosec}\, x = \dfrac{1}{\sin x} \text{ is discontinuos at } x = 0.
